ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a good understanding of basic MSA and reading, writing, and listening skills.

I learned how to speak, read, and write basic expressions in Modern Standard Arabic pertaining to greetings, introductions, food, family, numbers, and the weather. We also began learning some grammar (sentence structure, imperfect and present tense, etc.)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The use of different media (textbook, video, in-class conversation) really helped solidify my nascent language skills. I also liked having Friday classes asynchronous, as this gave me the opportunity to solidify the vocabulary and subjects learned each week. Some activities were slightly unclear because they featured content we didn't know yet; while I think such experiences are a part of language-learning, I think being more explicit about how much we were supposed to know beforehand might be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Arabic is hard! But it is such a beautiful and rich language; I highly recommend this course!
